TopicTitle: Soyuz Replica w/ Life Support and Functional LES!

Articles.Content:
My attempt at creating a Soyuz in KSP. Procedural fairings came in handy when creating the forward module, which houses the battery and life support equipment.

Not a perfect replica, but pretty decent.

Mods used:

- KW Rocketry

- Stretchy Tanks

- Procedural Fairings

- TAC Life Support

- Joint Reinforcement

- Mechjeb

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Still doing some testing. Will upload the craft file once I am completely satisfied with performance!
FYI, the Stage 0 boosters were installed at a 45 degree angle because of the Vernier boosters. Still nice though.

Can you try it with my Soyuz? (SOME PICTURES WERE TAKEN USING GRAVITY HACK BECAUSE I WAS TOO LAZY TO GO TO SPACE.) (also the kerbals look messed up, because they're clipped into each other, but on the inside(1st person view) it looks fine.) http://www./view/ikhlr37art9hvgb/Pieces%20VIII.craft

As the fuel drains, transfer the fuel from the toridal("O") fuel tank into the bottom fuel tank.

When reentering, undock the docking module when it reaches 70,000 m (when you can't time warp/when you start touching the upper atmosphere) You may need to use RCS to move away from it.

Just after that, decouple the service module. (MAKE SURE TO KEEP SAS "ON" THE WHOLE TIME WHEN YOU'RE REENTERING.

When the Capsule reaches 9,000 m, turn off SAS and deploy chute. (The picture shows the capsule right before touch down.

RIGHT BEFORE TOUCHDOWN (100 m) TURN ON SAS AND ORIENT THE CAPSULE SO THAT IT IS POINTING STRAIGHT.(The picture barely shows the capsule in it's landing position, LANDING, with the fuel tank acting as an airbag) (I recommend emptying the fuel tank before you reenter, well you most likely would)

And all the crew and the capsule are safe on the ground.
